ai.summary: An easy 2.4 km coastal hike on the Green Trail at Giant's Causeway in Northern Ireland. The route offers sea views, basalt column scenery, and a gentle, well-marked path suitable for most ages. Plan for about 1–1.5 hours and check tide and weather conditions before you go.
ai.terrain_summary: Coastal path over uneven ground with basalt columns, compact gravel, and occasional steps. Portions are exposed along the headland; trails can be slippery when wet and near sea spray. Wear sturdy footwear and stay mindful of footing.
ai.safety_notes: Despite the easy rating, the trail runs along cliff edges and across uneven basalt surfaces. Wear sturdy shoes with good grip; stay on marked paths; avoid wet, mossy rocks. Check tide tables and weather forecast; avoid exposed sections in strong winds or high seas. Bring water, sun protection, and a small first aid kit. In an emergency, call UK emergency services (999).
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking shoes with good grip
Map or offline GPS / charged phone
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) typically offers the best conditions, with May–September often providing milder weather and longer daylight.

seo.title: Green Trail, Giant's Causeway – Easy 2.4 km Coastal Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the Green Trail at Giant's Causeway, a short and easy 2.4 km coastal hike in Northern Ireland. Learn about terrain, safety tips, best seasons, and gear.
